meanings.sent1: The company decided to rerelease the popular movie for the holidays.
meanings.sent2: They plan to rerelease the updated version of the software next month.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the rerelease button, and now the song is playing again!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, a rerelease of joy that brightened everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The sun seemed to rerelease its warmth as the clouds parted, welcoming a new day.

meanings.definition: A subsequent release of a previously released item
meanings.sent1: The rerelease of the classic album brought back nostalgic memories for many fans.
meanings.sent2: Fans eagerly awaited the rerelease of the limited edition sneakers.
meanings.sent3: The rerelease of the book caused a frenzy among collectors trying to get a copy.
meanings.sent4: The rerelease of the movie in theaters sparked renewed interest in the film.
meanings.sent5: The rerelease of the video game included bonus content that excited players.
